body.p:
Frankfort Ky
Executive Dept
Aug 20th 1861
Genl. W. T. Withers
Commanding at Camp Boone
Near Clarksville Tenn --

Sir, The bearer of this letter. Mr J. D. White who has charge of the Arsenal and arms at this place, is fully authorized by me to identify, demand and receive any arms in your Camp or under your control belonging to the State of Kentucky. I was gratified to learn this morning through a lettter from Mr Guthrie the President of Louisville and Nashville Railroad Company that you had given Mr W. W. Frazer thier agent, assurances, that whenever an authorized agent from the State of Ky, came prepared to proove the guns at Camp Boone, were the property of the State, they would be immediatley given up.

Respectfully & truly your obt svt
B. Magoffin
